At the beginning of 1509 two other pamphlets‚ each in German and Latin garb, issued from the same prolific source. One deals with the Paschal Feast, and in the other, ‘⁶ The Jews’ Enemy‚”2 it is pointed out that Jews become physicians merely to facilitate the murder of Christians: the author is, however, liberal- nnnded enough to adnut that then enqssoynunst as scavengers might be unobjectionable.
